intro: Symplocos kinabaluensis, commonly known as the Kinabalu symplocos, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments at high altitudes. Symplocos kinabaluensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its montane habitat.
